body:
So, I just want to get a good recording software that is (easy enough) to use. If you want to know my PC specs:

CPU: Intel core i7 5960x
1st GPU: NVIDA GeForce 780
2nd GPU: NVIDA Quadro k6000
HDD: 3TB
32GB RAM
Operating System: Windows 7, 64-bit
General:
Minecraft FPS: Around 1500 RAM: 24, Mods: Optifine 
FPS Stability: 78%
Grid Autosport: 60FPS (Locked)
$$$: 3-6k (Cheap for a BEAST PC)
Monitor: 24 Inch monitor (Dell)
Monitor2: 18 Inch Monitor (Acer)
Keyboard: Razer DeathStalker
Mouse: Razer DeathAdder

Backup PC:

Intel core i7 4770k
1st GPU: NVIDA GeForce GTX 720
2nd GPU: AMD FirePro S10000 
HDD: 2TB
16GB RAM
Operating System: Windows 7, 64-bit
General:
Minecraft FPS: 1200, RAM: 8GB
FPS Stability: 78%
$$$: 4k
Monitor: 1st Ones ^^^

So there you have my basic PC, and Recommend away! [Fraps, costs around 50$.. So no]

title: Recording Softwares?

replies.body: Why... Do you need... that... for minecraft.
replies.body_tagged: Why... Do you need... that... for minecraft.

replies.body:
OBS

Pros:
-No watermark
-Unlimited recording time
-Not that laggy
Cons:
-Extended setup
replies.body_tagged:
OBS

Pros:
-No watermark
-Unlimited recording time
-Not that laggy

replies.body: Do you do lots of video rendering and editing with that Nvidia Quadro of yours?
replies.body_tagged: Do you do lots of video rendering and editing with that Nvidia Quadro of yours?

replies.body: Yes indeed! I dont also just do video rendering, I need a powerful GPU to run SolidWorks. And make the animation/Reaction of the tool that is needed to be edited :). But not only that xD but ye.. Video editing :P once in a while

replies.body:
Finally someone who uses a GPU and CPU to what it's intended for, not for bragging rights :P

I applaud you.

Haven't had much experience with recording software though, take some suggestions from other forum users.
